llm.feedback:
**Actionable feedback (compact paragraph)**  
Your draft is a solid first pass but still falls short of a world‑class, multi‑year structural analysis. 1) **Anchor the narrative in first‑principles**: explicitly tie the four regimes (cloud/AI, e‑commerce, EV, workforce) to macro fundamentals—real‑rate differentials, terms‑of‑trade, productivity growth, BoP, and the Fed’s policy‑reaction function. 2) **Map a clear causal chain**: show how policy shocks (tariff hikes, EV tax‑credit removal, Fed rate path) feed into cost pressures, margin compression, and ultimately share‑price transmission for each sector. 3) **Quantify every claim**: use the exact figures from the sources (e.g., Microsoft Q4 revenue $76.4 B, 18 % YoY; Azure 39 % growth; Shopify revenue $2.7 B, 31 % YoY; Rivian cash $7.5 B, DOE loan $6.6 B; Tesla gross margin 17.9 % vs 17.2 % last year; JUST index 17.3 % outperformance). 4) **Add specific catalysts and invalidation points**: R2 launch (price $45 k), Tesla robotaxi pilot, tariff rollback, Fed rate cuts, AI adoption acceleration. 5) **Structure scenarios**: base case (Fed holds, tariffs persist, AI adoption steady), upside (Fed cuts, tariff rollback, AI boom), downside (Fed hikes, supply‑chain shock, AI slowdown). 6) **Reconcile conflicts**: if any source contradicts (e.g., Microsoft’s cloud growth vs. Amazon’s lead), note the divergence and explain which metric drives the valuation. 7) **Cite only source IDs**: e.g., (0G3A676BP), (TN66GHPAT), (P0K0UEOHU), (4LQD15CFU). 8) **Conclude with a concise base‑case valuation, key risks, watch list, and confidence rating** (e.g., “Base case: Microsoft +15 % CAGR, Shopify +12 % CAGR, Rivian +20 % upside if R2 hits 2026; Risks: Fed hikes, tariff rollback, AI slowdown; Watch: Fed minutes, tariff announcements, AI adoption metrics; Confidence: moderate”). 9) **Ensure coverage of all critical sources**: Microsoft, Shopify, Rivian, Tesla, JUST index, cloud‑growth data, and the EV tax‑credit policy. 10) **Add a brief discussion of real‑rate differentials and BoP** to satisfy the first‑principles requirement.  Implement these edits and the analysis will meet the multi‑year, structural, and citation‑dense standards expected.
